title: DaySide
text:
DaySide was an American <a href="news">news</a>/<a href="talk%20show">talk show</a> on the <a href="Fox%20News%20Channel">Fox News Channel</a>, which aired weekdays at 1:00 p.m. <a href="North%20American%20Eastern%20Time%20Zone">ET</a>. Unlike most <a href="news%20channel">news channel</a> programs, it had a <a href="audience">live audience</a> giving reaction throughout the program, similar to the <a href="CNN">CNN</a> show "<a href="TalkBack%20Live">TalkBack Live</a>".
<a href="Linda%20Vester">Linda Vester</a> hosted the show until July 2005, when she left on a one-year maternity leave, but did not return. <a href="Mike%20Jerrick">Mike Jerrick</a> and <a href="Juliet%20Huddy">Juliet Huddy</a> hosted until they began preparing for "<a href="The%20Morning%20Show%20with%20Mike%20and%20Juliet">The Morning Show with Mike and Juliet</a>" on <a href="Fox%20Broadcasting%20Company">FOX</a> <a href="O%26amp%3BO">O&O</a> stations. "<a href="The%20Live%20Desk%20%28U.S.%20TV%20program%29">The Live Desk</a>" with <a href="Martha%20MacCallum">Martha MacCallum</a> replaced "Dayside" soon after the last show on September 22, 2006. In June 2008 since the show gone The Live Desk produced two hours (1-3 p.m.) to replace <a href="E.D.%20Hill">America's Pulse</a>, with <a href="Trace%20Gallagher">Trace Gallagher</a> becoming co-host with MacCallum.
